value.description: TestScript example resource with setup to delete if present and create a new instance of a Patient then update that Patient to create a minimum history; and single test definition to get the history of that Patient with various asserts.
value.purpose: Patient (Conditional) Create, Update, Delete and History (Instance) Operations

link.description: Demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services.

capability.description: Patient Update, Delete and History (Instance) Operations

operation.label: SetupDeletePatient
operation.description: Execute a delete operation to insure the patient does not exist on the server.

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK) or 204(No Content).

operation.label: SetupCreatePatient
operation.description: Create patient resource on test server using the contents of fixture-patient-create

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 201(Created).

operation.label: SetupUpdatePatient
operation.description: Update patient resource on test server using the contents of fixture-patient-update

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).

test.name: History Patient
test.description: Get the history for a known Patient and validate response.

operation.description: Get the Patient history on the test server using the id from fixture-patient-create.

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Confirm that the returned Bundle conforms to the base FHIR specification.
Confirm that the returned Bundle type equals 'history'.

id: testscript-example-multisystem

url: http://hl7.org/fhir/TestScript/testscript-example-multisystem

identifier: urn:oid:1.3.6.1.4.1.21367.2005.3.7.9878

version: 1.0

name: testscript-example-multisystem

title: Multisystem Test Script

status: draft

experimental: true

date: 18/01/2017

publisher: HL7

contact:

description: TestScript example resource showing use of origin and destination for multisystem support. The single origin will execute a Patient read against the two destination systems using user defined dynamic variables. The test engine will wait at each operation action with a defined origin and destination for the origin test system to send the expected FHIR operation to the destination test system. Once the expected request and response is observed, the test engine will continue with the test execution.

jurisdiction: United States of America (the) (Details : {urn:iso:std:iso:3166 code 'US' = 'United States of America', given as 'United States of America (the)'})

purpose: Patient Read Operation

copyright: HL7.org 2011+

destination

index: 1

profile: FHIR-Server (Details: [not stated] code FHIR-Server = 'FHIR-Server', stated as 'null')

destination

index: 2

profile: FHIR-Server (Details: [not stated] code FHIR-Server = 'FHIR-Server', stated as 'null')

value.name: testscript-example-multisystem
value.title: Multisystem Test Script
value.description: TestScript example resource showing use of origin and destination for multisystem support. The single origin will execute a Patient read against the two destination systems using user defined dynamic variables. The test engine will wait at each operation action with a defined origin and destination for the origin test system to send the expected FHIR operation to the destination test system. Once the expected request and response is observed, the test engine will continue with the test execution.

link.description: Demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services.

test.name: ReadPatient-Destination1
test.description: Read a Patient from the first destination test system using the user defined dynamic variable ${Dest1PatientResourceId}. Perform basic validation.

operation.description: Read a Patient from the first destination test system and perform basic validation.

assert.description: Confirm that the request method GET was sent by the client system under test.
Confirm that the client requested an Accept of xml.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is XML.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Patient.

test.name: ReadPatient-Destination2
test.description: Read a Patient from the second destination test system using the user defined dynamic variable ${Dest2PatientResourceId}. Perform basic validation.

operation.description: Read a Patient from the second destination test system and perform basic validation.

assert.description: Confirm that the client requested an Accept of xml.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is XML.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Patient.

value.name: TestScript Example Read Test
value.description: TestScript example resource with ported Sprinkler basic read tests R001, R002, R003, R004. The read tests will utilize user defined dynamic variables that will hold the Patient resource id values.

link.description: Demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services.

test.name: Sprinkler Read Test R001
test.description: Read a known Patient and validate response.

operation.description: Read the known Patient resource on the destination test system using the user defined dynamic variable ${KnownPatientResourceId}.

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is XML.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Last-Modified is present. Warning only as the server might not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Patient.
Confirm that the returned Patient conforms to the base FHIR specification.

test.name: Sprinkler Read Test R002
test.description: Read an unknown Resource Type and validate response.

operation.description: Attempt to read the Parameters resource type. What we really want here is an illegal type but the build process won't allow that. Parameters is a valid resource which doesn't have an end-point so, this should fail.

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 404(Not Found).

test.name: Sprinkler Read Test R003
test.description: Read a known, non-existing Patient and validate response.

operation.description: Attempt to read the non-existing Patient resource on the destination test system using the user defined dynamic variable ${NonExistsPatientResourceId}.

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 404(Not Found).

test.name: Sprinkler Read Test R004
test.description: Read a Patient using a known bad formatted resource id and validate response.

operation.description: Attempt to read a Patient resource on the destination test system using known bad formatted resource id.

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 400(Bad Request).

test.description: Create a Patient resource and capture the returned HTTP Header Location. Then search for (read) that Patient using the Location URL value and validate the response.

Confirm that the returned format is XML.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.

Confirm that the returned Bundle total is greater than or equal to the number of returned entries.

value.name: TestScript Example
value.description: TestScript example resource with setup to delete if present and create a new instance of a Patient; and single test definition to read the created Patient with various asserts.
value.purpose: Patient Conditional Create (Update), Read and Delete Operations

link.description: Demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services.

capability.description: Patient Update, Read and Delete Operations

operation.label: SetupDeletePatient
operation.description: Execute a delete operation to insure the patient does not exist on the server.

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK) or 204(No Content).

operation.label: SetupCreatePatient
operation.description: Create patient resource on test server using the contents of fixture-patient-create

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 201(Created).

operation.description: Read the created patient resource on the test server using the id from fixture-patient-create. Verify contents.

assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned Patient contains the expected family name 'Chalmers'. Uses explicit compareToSourceId reference to fixture-patient-create used to create the Patient.

test.name: Read Patient
test.description: Read a Patient and validate response.

operation.description: Read the patient resource on the test server using the id from fixture-patient-create. Prevent URL encoding of the request.

assert.label: 01-ReadPatientOK
assert.description: Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Last-Modified is present. Warning only as the server might not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Patient.
Confirm that the returned Patient conforms to the base FHIR specification.
Confirm that the returned Patient contains the expected family name 'Chalmers'. Uses explicit sourceId reference to read responseId fixture.
Confirm that the returned Patient contains the expected given name 'Peter'. Uses explicit sourceId reference to read responseId fixture.

Confirm that the returned Patient contains the expected family name 'Chalmers'. Uses explicit compareToSourceId reference to fixture-patient-create used to create the Patient and implicit reference to read response payload.

Confirm that the returned Patient contains the expected family name 'Chalmers'. Uses explicit compareToSourceId reference to fixture-patient-create used to create the Patient and explicit reference to read response payload and default operator of 'equals'.
Confirm that the returned resource contains the expected retained elements and values. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.

operation.description: Delete the patient resource on the test server using the id from fixture-patient-create.

parameters.description: A use context type and quantity- or range-based value assigned to the activity definition

parameters.name: context-type-value
parameters.description: A use context type and value assigned to the activity definition

parameters.description: The description of the activity definition

parameters.name: jurisdiction
parameters.description: Intended jurisdiction for the activity definition

parameters.name: publisher
parameters.description: Name of the publisher of the activity definition

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The human-friendly name of the activity definition

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The uri that identifies the activity definition

parameters.name: version
